name: Montgomery's Inn Cooking Class: Chef Jean Régis Raynaud and Chef Victor Ugwueke
description:
Join us for a special cooking experience with Chef Jean Régis Raynaud of Le Baratin and special guest Chef Victor Ugwueke from Afrobeat Kitchen. Discover the flavors of Nigeria through a cooking class, storytelling, and shared food. Take part in both the cooking and dining with these renowned chefs at the historic Montgomery's Inn. 

Limited spots – reserve your ticket today!
Food contains meat, gluten, dairy, and shellfish. No substitutions.
Non-resident surcharge will not apply.
Tickets are non-refundable.

name: Market 707
description: Open year-round, Market 707 is an outdoor shipping container market featuring 20 local businesses. Located in the heart of Downtown Toronto, a few blocks from Kensington Market, drop by to taste delicious street food and explore unique goods and services. Online ordering is also available from most vendors.

name: La Palette's 25th Anniversary Celebration
description:
From the get-go, owners Shamez Amlani, Maria Flawia Litwin, and their staff and friends were key drivers of urban activism. Through movements like Parking Meter Parties, Pedestrian Sundays and The Blackout Anniversary parades, the community surrounding La Palette has distinctly made the city a better place to live.

Very quickly, La Palette became an essential third place for successive waves of multicultural artists. Fundamentally, legendary local bands such as Lemon Bucket Orkestra, Moskitto Bar and Moneka Arabic Jazz were nurtured by this expansive, open community. 

Our friends at the Drom Artist Collective have created a magical 200-page book, detailing the characters and stories behind the community we hold dear. Come hang out share some food, drinks, stories. 

Please come join us for this next installment of our community-building exercise.

name: DakhaBrakha
description:
A genre-defying quartet from Kyiv, returns with their signature "ethno chaos", a bold blend of Ukrainian folk, punk, pop, rap, and global rhythms from India, Arabia, Africa, and Australia. 

Known for their powerful vocal harmonies and theatrical performances, they create an immersive, boundary-pushing sound that is both deeply rooted in Ukrainian tradition and globally inspired. Dressed in modern interpretations of traditional Ukrainian attire, DakhaBrakha delivers electrifying live shows that NPR calls "utter brilliance."
